page.title: 13The View from Beacon Hill
page.content: If you stand at the top of Beacon Hill which is 204 metres high and look in a general Westerly direction you can see Bulford Camp, Bulford, Amesbury and Boscombe Down. To the North West in the distance can be seen the Seven Sisters group of trees.. In the Foreground is Bulford Camp Sports field and a Firing Range. Looking South West the Naafi Warehouse can be seen and slightly to the South, Boscombe Down A&AEE.A variety of fixed wing aircraft and helicopters fly overhead, some showing R.A.F. roundels and colours and others Army. The ground about us is covered in rough grass and thistles with chalk and flints showing through. There are small blackthorn and gorse bushes, and the ground is deeply rutted where heavy Army vehicles have crossed.
